    <h3>Profile</h3>
    <p>
      Currently, I am working on the silicon microstrip detector for the Compressed Baryonic Matter (CBM) experiment.
      My work involves optical inspection and characterization of silicon sensors. I also develop image-processing
      methods to locate defects such as implant breaks, open passivation, dust contamination, and damaged AC/DC pads.
    </p>
    <p>
      I specialize in transforming complex datasets into <strong>reliable, actionable insights</strong> through
      reproducible workflows developed within international collaborations such as <strong>CBM/FAIR</strong>,
      <strong>GSI Helmholtz Centre</strong>, and <strong>Goethe University Frankfurt</strong>.
    </p>
